name: mod1
description: This graphics project requires you to create a 3D model of a water flow simulator on a surface. Recreate the hydrodynamics of a wave, tsunami, or rain. Don't forget your umbrella!

name: Corewar Championship
description: Create the ultimate Corewar Champion and crush any competition!

name: Open Project I
description:
This project is an opportunity to get acquainted with the long-term project management, around a favorite subject of yours.
You are completely free to choose the topic. Your only constraints are 1) to work in a group with other students of 42, 2) to complete it over a five-month period.

name: C Exam Alone In The Dark - Beginner
description:
Les examens machine permettent de vérifier vos acquis lorsque vous êtes seuls face à votre travail, sans vos peers et sans internet.
Pour valider ce projet (qui est un pré-requis à votre départ en 1er stage), il vous faut valider 5 examens avec une note minimum de 75.

name: Malloc
description: What is hiding inside malloc? You're using it from C pool, but it's not a system call. Discover the inner workings of an optimal memory management, and recode it, as well as free and realloc.

name: Piscine PHP
rules: You must be at least level 5 in cursus 42
description: The PHP Piscine is the gateway to all of the 42 curriculum web projects. It addresses the fundamentals related to this technology in two weeks of challenges including daily projects and weekend rushes. Oh what webs we weave.

name: Nm-otool
description: Dig into the format of the MacOS executables and discover how the kernel launches binaries, by rewriting these two system utilities. Essential for all those who want to work in cybersecurity, this project is more generally an introduction to the culture of the UNIX system.

name: Philosophers
description: How to handle concurrent access of multiple processes to shared resources? This project introduces you to the problematics of parallel programming via the famous problem of the "dining philosophers".

name: ft_script
description: By recoding the script command you will have an opportunity to understand the interactions between user input and tty, including line discipline, and pseudo-terminals. When this project is finished, you will finally know why a Ctrl-C in your shell interrupts the running program!

name: 42run
rules: You must have validated scop. You must have validated first-internship
description: Have you played Temple Run? It's time to do it again! This intermediate OpenGL project invites you to recreate this mobile game. Have fun: we encourage you to add bonuses that will outshine the famous franchise.

name: LibftASM
description: This project requires you to make a mini-lib in ASM, repeating the functionality of the selected libc functions. At the end of this project, you will be familiar with the assembly language syntax, the operations of the stack, and the behavior of the compiler. This is absolutely essential to get access to the security projects as well as system administration.

name: HumanGL
description: This intermediate OpenGL project is an introduction to hierarchical modeling. You will learn how to use matrices to link different parts of a humanoid model and animate them.

name: ft_p
description: This introductory project on UNIX network programming invites you to create client-server services similar to ftp. Bonus: respect the standard to make your program interoperable with existing tools!

name: IRC
description: This project on UNIX network programming invites you to create client-server services identical to IRC. Your implementation must use select (2) in a proper way to handle simultaneous client connections, as well as rotating buffers to handle client messages.

name: ComputorV1
description:
This project is the first of a series to refresh your knowledge about basic mathematical concepts, which will be very useful for many of the following projects. It is not a question of "doing math for math's sake", but to allow you to advance in the necessary topics at a steady pace.

You are allowed to choose a language to implement this subject.

name: Zappy
rules: You must have validated 1 of irc and ft_p. You must have validated first-internship
description: This project is the culmination of your previous efforts in advanced UNIX: you will create a multiplayer game over the TCP/IP network. This game will consist of a server, a graphical client interface, and AI players. This is a comprehensive project that gives you the opportunity to demonstrate both creativity and technical knowledge!

name: N-puzzle
description: Implement a program in a favorite language of yours that is capable of solving the N-puzzle problem using A* search algorithm or one of its variants. In addition, you will use algorithm analysis to describe time and memory complexity of your program. Have fun!

name: Expert System
description: Create, in your favorite language, an expert system for propositional calculus. That is, a program capable of reasoning using a set of rules and initial facts to deduce certain other facts.

name: Gomoku
rules: You must have validated 1 of expert-system and n-puzzle. You must have validated first-internship
description: Ce projet vous demande de créer, dans le langage de votre choix, un jeu de Gomoku intégrant un joueur IA capable de battre un joueur humain le plus rapidement possible. Pour ce faire, vous allez implémenter un algorithme min-max mais aussi (et surtout), faire des recherches et essais pour trouver les heuristiques les plus adaptées. Ce ne sera pas aussi facile qu'un jeu de dames.

name: FdF
description:
Every programs you wrote until now were executing in text mode within your terminal.
Let's discover something more interesting: how to open a graphic window and draw inside ?
As a way to start your journey to graphic programming land, Fdf offers you to draw the wireframe of a 3D landscape.

name: Fract'ol
description: Discover 2D programming and the psychedelic universe of fractals using the minilibX in this project.

name: Wolf3d
description: Inspired by the world-famous 90's game of similar naming (which was the first FPS ever). Explore the technique of ray-casting. The goal is to create a dynamic view inside of a maze. How far will you go to create the best game we have ever seen?

name: RTv1
description: Discover the fundamental principles of Raytracing and computer-generated imagery. Create simple scenes involving objects and non complex lights.

name: RT
rules: You must have validated 1 of rtv1 and wolf3d
description: Passez à la vitesse supérieure ! Suite du Rtv1, le RT pousse beaucoup plus loin les possibilités du Raytracing : effet miroir, transparence, découpe des objets, applications de textures... Capitalisez sur le projet précédent pour réaliser une infrastructure capable de supporter toutes ces ramifications et obtenir de sublimes images de synthèse.

name: Rushes
description: Rushes are the best way to explore issues complementary to the regular projects of your curriculum, collaborating with your colleagues. Over the next few days, you will work intensively on a specific topic with a new teammate(s). Once notified, you have to be present on the D-day in a good mood to approach the proposed challenges in an enthusiastic manner. It's all about fun, after all!

name: Savoir Relier
description: Ce projet est un peu différent des autres. Pas de code cette fois-ci, un questionnaire vous est proposé, suivi d'un échange verbal avec un peer : le but ici est de vous permettre de prendre du recul sur vous-même et sur votre relationnel aux autres avant de partir en stage. Ceci afin de nourrir vos réflexions et votre positionnement lors de cette immersion dans le monde professionnel. C'est un pré-requis à votre départ en stage.

name: First Internship
rules: You must have validated 1 of hypertube, 42sh, corewar, and rt. You must have validated c-exam-alone-in-the-dark-beginner. You must have validated 1 of curriculum-vitae and savoir-relier. You must not have registered to entrepreneurship
description: This first step in the company is an important part of your 42 course. This internship is the moment when you will discover the professional world and implement your work capacity, adaptation, serving the market. This is a first element for your resume, and the opportunity to see emerge your future field of predilection.

name: 42sh
rules: You must have validated 1 of 21sh and ft_sh3
description: Building upon your previous work on 21sh, you will create a complete shell. Through this project, you will build your own complete shell based on a minimum set of features - up to job control and shell script. This project will consequently enable you to explore a large spectrum of standard UNIX (and POSIX) features.

name: Scop
description: This mini project is a first step towards the use of OpenGL. Read a 3D object from a file, render it properly, add rotation and texture. Voilà! Looks gorgeous, doesn't it?

name: ft_ls
description: To learn everything about the filesystem, and learn how files and repositories are stored, write your own version of one of the most used commands: ls.

name: minishell
description: The first step toward creating a shell. This project consists in writing a mini-shell able to read to evaluate basic command lines from a user. The reading part implies trivial lexical and syntactic analyses of the command line, and the evaluation part implies to locate the requested binary on the computer and run it, or running the corresponding code in case of a built in functionality of the shell.

name: ft_select
description: This project aims to introduce you to terminal manipulation with termcaps. Here you will learn how to create a user interface for a program launched in the terminal.

name: 21sh
rules: You must not have validated ft_sh2 and ft_sh3. You must have validated minishell
description:
On passe aux choses sérieuses ! Avec 21sh, vous allez devoir écrire une implémentation proche de la réalité de la boucle "read, eval, print" d'un shell.
A l'aide de la bibliothèque Termcaps, vous ajouterez une édition de ligne fonctionnelle et utile à la partie "read" de votre shell. Déplacements du curseur, édition, historique, multilignes, etc.
Mais surtout pour la partie "eval", oubliez la fonction ft_split que vous utilisiez dans votre Minishell pour découper la ligne de commande entrée par l'utilisateur ! 
21sh sera votre premier interprète réaliste, et en tant que tel, ce projet vous permettra de découvrir les analyses lexicale, syntaxique, et sémantique communes aux interprètes et aux compilateurs.
Avec des structures de données et des traitements adaptées, ajouter la gestions des pipes ("|") et des redirections ("<", "<<", ">>". ">") sera très simple !

name: Taskmaster
description: The goal of this project is to implement a simplified supervisor daemon in the language of your choice that will perform job control. The program then can be extended to provide advanced logging/reporting or communication over UNIX/TCP sockets.

name: Lem-ipc
rules: You must have validated 1 of ft_p and irc
description: Previously you've got a glimpse of how processes communicate over the network via TCP/IP protocol suite. Now the objective is to employ other UNIX tools to make the processes communicate locally. Expand your toolbox by creating a basic board game client.

name: strace
description: The first step in a series of C projects leading to the implementation of a mini-GDB, this project asks you to recode strace, a tool that allows you to list all the system calls made by a running program.

name: Rubik
rules: You must have validated 1 of n-puzzle and expert-system
description:
Non-trivial algorithmics project, the goal of which is to implement a solver of a Rubik's Cube.

You are free in the choice of language to implement the subject.

name: KrpSim
rules: You must have validated 1 of expert-system and n-puzzle
description:
This algorithmic project consists of writing a program that will optimize the performance of a process graph under resource constraints.You will explore the existing algorithms and choose, or even create, what seems to you the most suitable.

You are free in the choice of language to implement the subject.

name: Piscine CPP
description: The C++ Piscine is the next step in the 42 Curriculum. During these two weeks you will discover more about OOP by learning specifics of the C++ language. Successfully completing this challenge will unlock the object-oriented projects and prepare you for future objectives and jobs.

name: Abstract VM
description: Ce projet vous remet dans le bain après la piscine C++ et vous invite à réaliser une machine virtuelle capable d'exécuter un code en pseudo-ASM basique. Vous allez ainsi utiliser une stack pour faire des opérations arithmétiques basiques, à l'instar de la commande dc.

name: Bomberman
rules: You must have validated abstract-vm. You must have validated first-internship
description: Bomberman is a classic video game: as simple to learn and fun to play! Here you will take advantage of its simplicity to make your first big project of C    professionally. You will recode a version of Bomberman, in C    and OpenGL, with the aim of developing a game as fun as possible.

name: Piscine OCaml
description: This OCaml pool is the gateway to the functional programming projects of 42 curricula. You will take up with the functional paradigm while learning the specifics of OCaml language.

name: Final Internship
rules: You must be at least level 14 in cursus 42. You must have validated 1 of first-internship and entrepreneurship. You must not have registered to advanced-entrepreneurship
description: This is the final stage of your journey through the 42 curricula. The final internship marks the completion of your course and will hopefully provide an opportunity to demonstrate your professional expertise in an enterprise.

name: Part-time
rules: You must be at least level 14 in cursus 42. You must have validated first-internship
description: Successful professional integration remains one of the fundamental objectives of 42. This project gives you the opportunity to engage in a part-time professional activity on the third part of your schooling.

name: Nibbler
description: This CPP project makes you recode the Snake game with several different graphical interfaces, the player can switch between the interfaces during the game. This is an opportunity to discover how to load and use dynamic libraries at runtime.

name: Piscine Unity
rules: You must be at least level 8 in cursus 42. You must have validated piscine-cpp
description: Have you ever dreamed of making your own video game? We introduce you to Unity – a 2D and 3D graphics development platform that is easy to learn and hard to master. Develop your first video games during this pool!

name: Camagru
description: Ce premier projet vous remet dans le bain après la piscine PHP : vous allez devoir réaliser, en PHP, un petit site Instagram-like permettant à des utilisateurs de réaliser et partager des photo-montages. Vous allez ainsi implémenter, à mains nues (les frameworks sont interdits), les fonctionnalités de base rencontrées sur la majorité des sites possédant une base utilisateur.

name: Matcha
description: The second project introduces you to a more advanced tool to implement your web applications: the micro-framework. We invite you to create, in the language of your choice, a dating site. Interactions between users will be the core of the project!

name: Hypertube
description: The last project in its series, the Hypertube project invites you to discover an extremely powerful tool category: MVC frameworks. You will learn how to manipulate an MVC, in the language of your choice, to make a streaming video site downloaded via the BitTorrent protocol.

name: ft_linear_regression
rules: You must have validated 1 of expert-system and n-puzzle
description: Develop your first machine learning algorithm in your favorite language. Linear regression is the default entry point to more advanced topics of statistical learning. Bonuses include visualization, closed-form solution and a multivariate/logistic variant of regression.

name: Swifty Companion
rules: You must have validated 1 of piscine-cpp and piscine-swift-ios
description: This project aims to introduce you to iOS application development. To achieve this you will use Swift language to retrieves information about students, using the 42 API.

name: ft_hangouts
description:
The goal of this project is to introduce you to Android application development by creating a mobile contact management app in Java on Google's Android platform.
The goal here is to understand how an Android application works, how Android manages your application and how to use the SDK.

name: ft_traceroute
description: Recoding the traceroute command will be for you the opportunity to deepen your knowledge of the network protocols (TCP / IP) by tracking the paths that an IP packet will take between two machines.

name: ft_nmap
description: Recoding the nmap program will be for you the opportunity to advance your knowledge about the network (TCP / IP) protocols and threads in real use while implementing a part of the famous port scanner.

name: ft_ping
rules: You must have validated 1 of ft_p and irc
description: Recoding the ping command will allow you to get acquainted with the communication (TCP / IP) between two machines over the network.

name: ft_turing
description: ft_turing will introduce you to the Turing model underlying the imperative paradigm through an implementation of the Single-Tape Turing machine in OCaml language.

name: Snow Crash
description: An introductory project on computer security, Snow Crash aims to introduce security in different sub-domains, with a developer-oriented approach. You will become familiar with several languages (ASM / Perl / PHP...), develop a certain logic to understand unknown programs, and thus become aware of the problems related to simple "errors" in programming.

name: Darkly
rules: You must have validated piscine-php and first-internship
description: Projet introductif à la sécurité en informatique dans le domaine spécifique du web, ce projet va vous faire disséquer un site web vulnérable. Ce faisant, vous allez développer votre propre façon de penser "sécurité" dans une application web et prendre conscience des problèmes liés à de simples "erreurs" de développement, autant d'un point de vue programmation que d'un point de vue conception.

name: Swifty Proteins
description: This project aims to introduce you to Scene Kit - an Apple framework to create scenes in 3D. You will develop a 3D protein visualizer. You will also familiarize yourself with Touch ID, UISearchBar, and sharing in iOS. Basic understanding of biochemistry included!

name: Open Project II
description:
This second Open Project is an opportunity to improve your project management over the long term, producing a more successful project.
You are completely free in the choice of subject - it may be related to computers, or be entirely different!
Your only constraints are 1) working in a group with other students of 42, 2) to complete your project over a period of 8 months.

name: XV
description: This project is proposed by the company Daher and aims to asks you to develop a GUI using Unity for the purpose of industrial processes optimization.

name: In the Shadows
description: This project aims to make you develop a complete game requiring a little algo and a lot of creativity.

name: Particle System
description: This computer graphics project is an introduction to the wonderful world of the GPU. Discover OpenGL and OpenCL, that enable a massive parallelization of calculations. Create a particle system while respecting the imposed performance constraints.

name: ft_ality
description: This project will introduce you to the problems related to automatic syntactic analysis ("parsing"), by studying finite-state automata and regular languages in application to a combat game.

name: GBmu
description: This project requires you to make a Gameboy and Gameboy Color emulators. Become familiar with electronics documentation, and the emulation of hardware. Discover the inner workings of a Gameboy and ROMs. Have fun!

name: Friends with Benefits
rules: You must have validated piscine-php and first-internship
description: "Friends with Benefits" is a project in partnership with Cozy-Cloud. You will use the provided tools to create an open-source Single-Page Application. Cozy-Cloud will provide you the hosting on their service.

name: ft_linux
description: The first project of the Kernel branch! This is a simple LFS, so you build your own distribution on which you will work for future projects.

name: Woody Woodpacker
description: Project in the logical continuation of nm/otools which modifies the headers of a file of type ELF64. The goal here is to add a piece of code and obfuscate part of an unstripped file.

name: little-penguin-1
rules: You must have validated ft_linux. You must have validated libftasm
description: The beginning of a series of challenges inspired by the Eudyptula challenge, allowing you to tackle many points of kernel development.

name: RainFall
description: Rainfall is a slightly more complex challenge than Snow Crash that will plunge you into the intricacies of reverse engineering and teach you how to rebuild a code and understand its operation to find the flaws. Can you reach the last level?

name: Dr Quine
rules: You must have validated first-internship. You should have validated libftasm
description: This small algo project allows you to tackle the problematics of self-replication, and you confront Kleene's recursion theorem!

name: Matt Daemon
rules: You must have validated 1 of ft_p and irc
description: Unix project whose purpose is to create a server-side daemon. This server will listen on a given port and interpret a list of commands.

name: ft_printf
description: Vous en avez assez de faire vos affichages en alternant ft_putstr et ft_putnbr ? Vous n'avez pas le droit d'utiliser printf ? Recodez le votre ! Ce sera l'occasion de découvrir une feature du C - les fonctions variadiques - et de vous entrainer à la gestion fine des options d'affichage. Vous aurez ensuite le droit d'utiliser votre printf dans tous vos projets ultérieurs.

name: Filler
description: Create your player to fight other students on the world famous (or infamous) Filler board. The concept is simple: two players gain points by placing on a board, one after the other, the game piece obtained by the game master (in the form of an executable Ruby program). The game ends when the game piece cannot be placed anymore. Have fun!

name: Push_swap
description: Through this project, you will have to sort a stack with a limit number of instructions, in as few moves as possible. To succeed, you'll need to use various sorting algorithms and choose the solution(s) most appropriate for a highly optimised data sorting.

name: Lem_in
rules: You must have validated 1 of push_swap and filler
description: You must move your ant colony from one point to another in the least amount of time. Through this project, you will explore graph traversal algorithms: your program will have to choose the paths and moves to be taken by the ants.

name: Corewar
description: Ce projet vous invite à créer une arène virtuelle et à y faire s’affronter des programmes codés dans un langage simpliste. Vous allez ainsi aborder la conception d’une VM (avec les instructions qu’elle reconnait, les registres, etc), et les problématiques de compilation d’un langage assembleur en bytecode. Avec, en bonus, le plaisir de faire s’affronter vos champions sur votre arène !

name: Process and Memory
description: An introduction to syscalls and memory management within linux kernel

name: init
description: This project will introduce you to the basic topics of DevOps. Provided by the slash16 team.

name: cloud-1
description: This project is an introduction to cloud servers. The subject requires you to build a simple cloud infrastructure on a real-world cloud provider platform of your choice.

name: Drivers and Interrupts
description: Learn how to connect a driver to your kernel. We will use a keyboard driver for this project.

name: Filesystem
rules: You must have validated drivers-and-interrupts. You must have validated process-and-memory
description: Create your own filesystem, for your linux kernel.

name: roger-skyline-2
rules: You must have validated init and first-internship
description: This project proposed by slash16 gives you the opportunity to build your own infrastructure inspired by that of 42.

name: KFS-1
description: Discover the world of "Kernel Programming" and learn how to create your very own Kernel from scratch.

name: Music Room
description: Project in partnership with "Deezer". Create a complete collaborative playlist mobile app using the Deezer SDK and API. Items on the agenda: native mobile development, back-end development, and REST API creation.

name: Piscine Swift iOS
description: This pool will introduce to you Swift programming language, it's main features and peculiarities.

name: Piscine Python Django
description: This project makes you responsible for designing a web back-end with unprecedented quality and performance using Django framework for Python scripting language.

name: KFS-2
description: Discover the world of "Kernel Programming" and learn how to create your very own Kernel from scratch.

name: KFS-3
description: Third "Kernel from Scratch" project. Learn how to manage the memory in you kernel.

name: Red Tetris
description: The goal of this project is to develop an online multiplayer Tetris game using pure Javascript on each stage of web development process.

name: 42 Commandements
description:
Bienvenue à 42, jeune cadet !
Avant de commencer ton aventure, il est important de comprendre ce que l'on attend de toi tout au long de ta scolarité.

name: Piscine Reloaded
description: Revoyez les bases de la piscine avec une suite d'exercices tirée des sujets de celle-ci.

name: Libft
description: Ce premier projet en tant qu'étudiant de 42 va vous faire consolider vos acquis de piscine. Vous allez recoder un certain nombre de fonctions de la librairie C standard, ainsi que d'autres fonctions utilitaires que vous réutiliserez tout au long de votre cursus.

name: Fillit
description: Fillit est un projet vous permettant de découvrir et/ou de vous familiariser avec une problématique récurrente en programmation : la recherche d'un solution optimale parmi un très grand nombre de possibilités, dans un délai raisonnable. Dans le cas de ce projet, il s'agira d'agencer des Tetriminos entre eux et de déterminer le plus petit carré possible pouvant les accueillir.

name: Get_Next_Line
description: Qu'il s'agisse d'un fichier, de l'entrée standard, ou même plus tard d'une connexion réseau, vous aurez toujours besoin de lire du contenu ligne par ligne. Il est donc temps de vous attaquer à cette fonction, indispensable pour un certain nombre de vos prochains projets.

name: H42N42
description: This project introduces you to the OCSIGEN framework, in order to create an OCaml rich internet application. Design a simulator of Bugs escaping a dangerous Virus!

name: Famine
rules: You must have validated libftasm, woody-woodpacker, and dr-quine
description: Welcome to the wonderful world of viruses, trojans and other sweet little things that the <Insert random antivirus software> is fighting with ... Your goal here is to use your skills to handle binary files and create your first virus. ATTENTION: This project is for educational purposes only.

name: Piscine Ruby on Rails
description: Learn how to design a powerful and robust WebApp using Ruby on Rails framework.

name: KFS-4
description: Projet visant a créer une Interrupt Description Table et gerer les interruptions avec votre Kernel.

name: docker-1
description: Premier projet sur l'écosystème Docker. Apprenez à réfléchir en containers à travers ce sujet, qui vous fera manipuler le binaire docker et créer vos premiers containers avec des Dockerfiles

name: KFS-5
description: A vous maintenant de développer la gestion des process dans votre Kernel, en implementant de quoi interpréter la commande :(){ :|:& };:

name: KFS-6
description: Keep on developping your own kernel. This project will help you set up your own filesystem.

name: avaj-launcher
description: First projet of the Java projects arc. Implementation of a simple Java program according to a given class diagram written in UML.

name: swingy
description: This is the second project from the Java world at 42. You will learn to develop GUI applications with the SWING framework, in order to create an RPG game.

name: fix-me
description: Final project of the Java Programming arc. Write a program that simulates stock exchanges and deals with trading algorithms, with networking and socket implementations.

name: Matrice
rules: You must be at least level 7 in cursus 42
description: Le programme entrepreneurial Matrice vous propose régulièrement de vous engager autour d'un thème sur une création d'entreprise. D'une durée pouvant aller de 10 à 16 mois, ce programme peut éventuellement être l'ultime étape de votre cursus et vous mener jusqu'au certificat délivré par l'école.

name: Override
description: If Rainfall seemed easy, this project will give you a hard time. Override is the latest challenge launched by ISO. It requires you to search for vulnerabilities in the protected binaries. The second step would be to reconstruct these binaries appertaining to their behavior.

name: Pestilence
description: The second project in the cybersecurity specialization. Add code obfuscation to the, mostly harmless, virus you've created during "Famine".

name: War
description: The third project in a series of virus development. Use "Pestilence" as a starting point to make the binary modify its signature at runtime.

name: Death
description: Last and ultimate virus project. Make the result of "Famine", "Pestilence" and "War" metamorphic.

name: Durex
rules: You must have validated matt-daemon. You should have validated dr-quine
description: Use your skills of daemon creation to implement a simple trojan virus.

name: Boot2Root
description: Challenge Securité : Cherchez en groupe les différents moyens de passer root sur l'ISO fournie en ressources.

name: Curriculum Vitae
rules: You must be at least level 5 in cursus 42
description:
We know that you are creative and outstanding individual. Yet there are certain social codes on the labour market that you must respect to be successful.
Your professional integration is of the highest value at 42. Hence, it's in our interest that your CV satisfies the highest standards.

name: ft_vox
rules: You must have validated scop. You should have validated 42run
description: ft_vox est un projet d'introduction au moteur de voxel, inspiré de minecraft, dans lequel vous devez créer un monde généré aléatoirement.

name: DSLR
description:
Subject proposed by the 42AI association.

Open yourself to the subject of Data Science through this project. Reproduce the Hogwarts Sorting Hat! Be careful, this is not a subject on cameras.

name: Electronics
description:
Le projet électronique consiste à fabriquer un prototype du projet de son choix : circuit et firmware.
On n'utilise pas de raspberry pi ou d'arduino, on les fabrique !

Pour suivre ce projet vous aurez besoin de savoir lire l'anglais et d'avoir un niveau correct en C (opérations binaires notamment).

Préparez-vous à suivre l'un des projets les plus durs du cursus et à sortir complètement de votre zone de confort. Vous serez en mode piscine au carré, et c'est voulu.
Comptez une à deux journées par semaine minimum pendant 6 mois pour aller au bout du projet.

name: ShaderPixel
description: Maintenant que vous êtes à l'aise avec les objets 3D et les techniques basiques de rendu, on va parler sérieux et travailler réellement dans l'espace de la carte graphique. A vous de composer et créer les objets les plus déments grâce à la programmation de shaders.

name: KFS-7
description: This project will teach you how to build your own syscalls for your kernel, as well as user accounts, sockets, and a Unix-like hierarchy. Almost a full kernel here!

name: KFS-8
description: Build a module interface for your kernel.

name: KFS-9
description: Create an ELF parser and loader for your kernel.

name: KFS-X
description: This is the final kernel project. It just requires you to create a complete linux environment. Maybe name your kernel aswell?

name: ComputorV2
description: Now that you've programmed your equation solver, it's time to go a step further. ComputorV2 offers you to create your own command line calculator, which will integrate your ComputorV1 as well as operations on matrices, polynomial solving, imaginary numbers, etc.
